ygData.msgSnippet: When it comes to prize money, I will follow everone else s wishes. Frankly, I did not really care about receiving a pirze. The biggest reasons for requesting

From: "Daniel Paul Hightower" <dph_of_rules@...>

When it comes to prize money, I will follow everone else's wishes.  
Frankly, I did not really care about receiving a pirze.

The biggest reasons for requesting the saved games is is to encourage 
the honor system.  I would expect the judges to post the stats for 
each person's team once everybody has turned the stats in at each 
stop point.  If anyone looking at the stats thought somebody was 
cheating, somebody could always challenge and a judge would work 
through the scenarios with the given team to check for cheating.  I 
would propose making sure that it would extremely difficult to end up 
with an archmage (that could summon either images or fire elementals) 
by going through the tournament scenarios and give extra points to 
teams that do NOT use clerics.

Two obvious questions remain:  How many people would be interested in 
a tournament (no entry fee with no prizes) and how many scenarios 
would be in this tournament?  I will like to a stipulation: no 
tournament unless 15 or more people are involved.

I am dead set against having closed discussions about a proposed 
tournament and its proposed rules.
